revised_title: An Investigation into the Functions and Acoustic Properties of the Tympanum
tldr: The author examines the functions and acoustic properties of the tympanum, specifically the Eustachian tube and the tympanic membrane, through personal observations and experiments. The study reveals that the membrane's ability to resist the transition of aerial vibrations and the Eustachian tube's role in sound transmission play a significant role in hearing and deafness.
